alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 6:54AM CDT until May 02 at 3:35PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County. For the Marmaton River Basin...including Fort Scott, Nevada...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Marmaton River near Nevada. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, minor flooding occurs near the gage site and affects low lying areas along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 20.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 AM CDT Sunday was 20.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 3.8 feet early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.5 feet on 05/13/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 700 AM CDT.
